name: places/ChIJT4I9GMbNwokR9LKUSwoH4Ok
formattedAddress: Teatro SEA at The Clemente, 107 Suffolk St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: Teatro SEA at The Clemente, 107 Suffolk St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: Had a fun time, in a group of four. It might not be the most terrifying haunted house out there, but the actors? Top-notch. They really brought their scenes to life with their energy. Sure, it's a quick ~13-minute adventure, but most haunted houses I've been to aren't much longer. Don't get hung up on the duration — just go and enjoy the ride!

originalText.text: This was a phenomenal experience! Andre did an amazing job introducing the experience to us and explaining what we should expect. The actors were great and committed to the scene. The teapot girl and the clown doing the museum tour were amazing!! My one friend who isn’t a fan of scary stuff even enjoyed herself. Overall it was probably a 5.5/10 scary factor lol. But enjoyable overall.

text.text: This was a phenomenal experience! Andre did an amazing job introducing the experience to us and explaining what we should expect. The actors were great and committed to the scene. But enjoyable overall.

originalText.text: I will tell you EXACTLY what to expect. The entire experience last about 8 minutes. The whole experience takes place between a bunch of black curtains, they did not even have the budget to create or use actual rooms. You first walk into a room (black curtains) and a doll greets you and welcomes you to the show, then you walk into a hall to see a display of dolls like chukee & Annabelle set up in cheap plastic boxes. Then you will sit at a tea party and the actress will offer you a roach. Then you will have to crawl in a tunnel full of doll heads (very underwhelming) and then you enter another room where you are told to look at a screen to see which "doll you are" and then asked to leave and walk through a short hall of flashing lights and doll heads and an actress dressed in doll heads. It terms of fear factor I'd give this a 1, it would hardly scare a young child. In terms of set design I'd give it a 0 because there was no effort put into the rooms, again it was literally just black curtains with no props. In terms of the actors I'd give them a 3, they were carrying the entire experience as there was nothing else the haunted house had to offer, but again the acting wasn't scary and very underwhelming. It cost $40 for this haunted house. The experience is worth about $10-15, maybe even less, it seems like it would've been better as part of a fair or bigger exhibit and not a stand alone haunted house. If someone asked me if they should go, I'd say no, save your money.

originalText.text: My gf got us tickets and we were looking forward to it. But, honestly, the scariest thing is how much of a complete rip off this experience felt. I wouldn’t call this a haunted house or a haunted experience. I don’t know what to call it. You will walk out confused at how that cost $45+ and how they get away with calling it a haunted house. Black curtains used to divide up a small space into a few very poorly decorated rooms. Characters aren’t scary at all, unless feeling awkward is scary to you. 10-15 min tops and you are done. The theme made no sense. It literally looks like they spent only $45 on decorations. Felt like a typical all hype, no value NYC experience. Please do better.

originalText.text:
The host at the entrance was a nice guy. It’s such a shame that this was such a let down. Literally no money spent on props, design or script. Interaction was minimal and the ‘event’ went nowhere. The scariest thing of the evening was walking In the dark from the subway station. Our trip to New York was amazing despite having wasted our money on this…not a single proper jump scare. I rarely complain or give a bad review. This company needs to listen to the feedback  and I genuinely feel we should get our money back.
If I could leave a zero star review I would.
Very sad
Update: the organiser kindly refunded me on expressing our disappointment, listened to our feedback and said they would be working on the show. Thanks for the refund
